Title: Bioinformatics Software Engineer I
Description:
Pay Range: $78,900.00-$126,200.00 Company Overview:
At Memorial Sloan Kettering (MSK), we’re not only changing the way we treat cancer, but also the way the world thinks about it. By working together and pushing forward with innovation and discovery, we’re driving excellence and improving outcomes. We’re treating cancer, one patient at a time. Join us and make a difference every day.

In compliance with applicable State regulatory authorities, COVID-19 vaccination is mandatory for all MSK staff. Staff are considered fully vaccinated upon completion of a primary vaccination series for COVID-19 (i.e., one dose of a single dose vaccine or a final dose of a multi-dose vaccine series). Exceptions from the COVID-19 vaccine requirement are permitted for those who request and receive an approved medical or fully remote exemption. Requests for medical exemption can take up to two weeks to review. Vaccination or an approved medical exemption is required to start work.

Staff working at a MSK New Jersey location must be up to date with COVID-19 vaccination, which includes having completed the primary COVID-19 vaccination series and booster once eligible as mandated by New Jersey State. All New Jersey staff not yet eligible for a booster must receive a booster within 3 weeks of becoming eligible as a condition of continued employment at MSK.

Note: Individuals are eligible to receive a COVID-19 booster two months after completion of a primary vaccination series for COVID-19. Because vaccine-induced immunity can wane over time, MSK continues to strongly urge all staff to get a COVID-19 booster as soon as they become eligible to maintain their protective immunity for a longer period.
Job Description:
Are you a Software Engineer enthusiastic about solving problems in biology, cancer genomics, and their clinical applications? We need you! The mission of the Center for Molecular Oncology (CMO) is to promote precision oncology through genomic analysis to guide the diagnosis and treatment of cancer patients . You will support the cBioPortal for Cancer Genomics. The cBioPortal is a highly successful open-source Web resource for exploring, visualizing, and analyzing multidimensional cancer genomics data, that supports the CMO as well as thousands of cancer researchers and clinicians around the globe.
You Are:
Passionate about cancer research and its clinical applications.
A software or data engineer with experience in developing software and data infrastructure
Eager to learn and apply new technologies and ideas to benefit the entire organization.
A Collaborator who enjoys being part of a team
You Will:
Write, test, and document code for data pipelines to extract, transform, and load (ETL) a variety of datasets from existing sources, including genomics and clinical data. Also help convert existing batch processes to an event-driven, asynchronous architecture.
Collaborate with team members, engineers from other institutes, and open source community developers to refactor or extend the cBioPortal back-end codebase to support evolving analysis or visualization needs.
Rapidly troubleshoot and solve problems with existing software systems & big data management.
Review code and documentation written by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices.
Participate in a development team that continually seeks to increase performance and is open to embracing new software engineering techniques and practices toward this goal.
You Have:
Master's degree or Bachelor's in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, or related field
Proven experience in software development
Strong skills in a programming language (e.g. Java, Go, Python).
Experienced in relational and non relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDb, Redis, Neo4J)
Experience with Agile software development and participating in a Scrum team
#LI-POST Location 417 East 68th St. (Zuckerman), New York, NY

Are you ready to learn more about our Benefits?


Pay Range $78,900.00-$126,200.00

Please click to learn more about MSK’s compensation philosophy.

Title: Founding Full-Stack Engineer
Description:
Confido is a next-generation financial automation and intelligence platform helping fast-growing CPG brands operate and scale more efficiently. Despite advances in technology, the tools to run and grow a business in retail haven’t changed. Today, the vast majority of brands rely on the same error-prone and expensive manual spreadsheet-based workflows.

Our first product helps brands track, account for, forecast, and optimize the up to 40% of revenue that is spent on retailer and distributor allowances, fines, promotions, and ads - helping brands become more profitable, eliminate dozens of hours of manual work, and unlock insights to GTM more efficiently. Today, we work with over a dozen fast-growing brands across categories and have raised 2.6M dollars from leading investors.

The Role:

We’re hiring a founding full-stack junior engineer with a concentration to expand our product capabilities and help in delighting our customers. The role will be based in NY, and we will gladly help you relocate if needed. Total compensation for the role will range between $130,000 and $160,000 + Benefits + Meaningful Equity (1% - 2%).

Responsibilities

(1) Architect new components and products within the platform

(2) Maintain deep integrations with partners

(3) Codify complex CPG logic into the product in a maintainable and digestible way

Requirements

(1) Strong technical background with 1+ years of full-time engineering experience

(2) Scrappiness and interest in learning the ins and outs of the CPG industry

Preferred qualifications

(1) Excellent communication skills with the ability to talk directly with customers and convert to new features/improvements

(2) Strong desire to work at an early-stage startup and touch all parts of the product CS or equivalent degree

Compensation Range: $130K - $160K

Title: Java Developer/QuerySurge division (entry-level)​
Description:
Who We Are

QuerySurge is the enterprise software division of RTTS, a company with headquarters in New York City since 1996. We are seeking a Java/Web Developer to be an integral part of the team developing our enterprise software application in the Big Data/Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence space that is quickly becoming the industry standard (130+ corporate customers in 30 different countries). For more information, please visit our website at www.querysurge.com

What you'll be doing:
Full — stack development using Java and MySQL technologies
Developing, maintaining and supporting our enterprise software
Interacting with customers, alliance partners and our internal team of marketing, operations, sales, and support people
Making a big impact on a small team!
What qualifications you need for this position:
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or equivalent
2+ years developing with Java
1+ years developing with React
Experience with JavaScript, HTML, CSS
Experience with SQL; MySQL experience is a plus
Experience with Tomcat
Experience with source control management such as SVN, GIT
Experience working with JSON
Desire to expand your skill-set and gain experience with cutting-edge technologies
What’s in it for you:
Competitive salary based on experience
The opportunity to work with a hot product in a hot software sector
Exposure to Fortune 500 clients and top 10 software industry-leading firms
Full benefits + share points if company is acquired

This position is based in our Manhattan office. You must reside locally. We do not provide relocation support.

You must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer.

If you are interested in joining our team, apply today by submitting your resume to info@querysurge.com

Involving in setting up PeopleSoft Security and providing technical & functional support to define the security related objects.

Title: Software Test Engineer
Description:
About Osmose

With 85 years of experience, Osmose proudly serves the electric utility and telecommunications industries across the U.S., helping enable the delivery of safe, reliable and affordable electricity and communications services to millions of customers nationwide. We are the industry leader in wood and steel structure condition assessment, life-extension and rehabilitation services. Our mission is to accurately inspect and mitigate aging infrastructure in a planned, programmatic manner that minimizes owner costs while maximizing benefits.

Headquartered in Peachtree City, Georgia, with satellite offices in Atlanta, Buffalo, Syracuse and Boston, the Osmose footprint extends throughout the country. Our employees are inspired to perform each and every day by our core values of integrity, customer focus, safety, respect, excellence, flexibility, efficiency and ownership. Our staff and field personnel represent some of the most tenured, well trained, and innovative professionals in the industry.

Osmose is currently seeking a Software Test Engineer to test and document software configurations and applications.

Responsibilities

Develop and document test procedures for software applications and configurations relating to customer project solutions and/or product solutions
Perform testing of software applications and configurations relating to customer project solutions and/or product solutions
Work and communicate effectively with project managers and team members
Follow the software development process methodology
Report problems identified during testing utilizing the software problem tracking system.
Perform all other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s or Associate’s degree in Software Engineering Technology, Computer Science or related field; or one to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Possess a strong and extensive working knowledge of computer hardware and software – proficiency on Microsoft platforms are preferred.
Willingness to work varied hours whenever necessary to achieve the desired results.
Willingness to travel to customer, vendor and industry meeting locations, if required.
Highly organized and detail oriented.
Embrace core values of the Company.
Commitment to supporting all Company policies.

Benefits

Come grow with us! Full-time employees enjoy a comprehensive benefits package that includes:

Medical Insurance and Health Savings Account with company contribution
Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, STD, LTD, Critical Illness Plan and more!
401(k) with excellent company match
Paid time off (vacation, sick, floating holidays)

Osmose is an Equal Opportunity employer. EOE M/F/Disabled/Vet

Title: Associate Email Developer
Description:
Company Description


EBG is an e-commerce solutions provider specializing in travel and entertainment, and also offering retail products and services, voluntary benefits and insurance.

EBG powers a robust portfolio of technology solutions and operates a network of employer and membership-based platforms reaching a captive audience, providing leading brands with incremental distribution opportunities. EBG's expanded network reaches over 100 million users from participating companies and closed loop affinity and membership groups.

EBG owns and operates one of the largest and most comprehensive employee savings programs in the country — serving over 40,000 corporate clients through its proprietary platforms TicketsatWork, Plum Benefits, Working Advantage and Beneplace.

EBG is a b2b2c company headquartered in Miami (Aventura), with offices in New York, Orlando, Ormond Beach, Austin and Las Vegas. We offer a hybrid work environment with a balance of collaboration and flexibility.



Job Description


The Jr. Email Developer will be responsible for email campaign execution, as well as supporting the coding and development of all email programs across multiple platforms and brands. In this role, they will collaborate with internal business partners to execute email campaigns that drive the business. They will support lead developers and marketing leads on projects and will work to uphold and adhere to best practices of email design and coding principles.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Supports email campaign production across multiple platforms, including setup, QA, and deployment.
Adheres to process for execution and on-time delivery of complex, highly dynamic promotional email campaigns.
Participate in the QA/QC of all email campaigns (audit creative, promotional messaging, links, segment selection, set up, etc.)
Works with cross-functional account managers to coordinate on campaign assets.
Supports lead developers on updating HTML/CSS in email templates or content/snippet blocks.
Supports marketing leads on email test setup, execution, and reporting.
Understands basic segmentation principles and how segmentation relates to daily email campaigns and CRM trigger campaigns.
Perform additional duties as assigned.


Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in marketing, computer science or other related field.
1-3 years of hands-on email production experience in relevant industry executing marketing campaigns.
Ability to code and edit emails utilizing HTML and CSS.
Experience in coding emails for responsive design.
Intermediate knowledge of the latest HTML, CSS, and JavaScript techniques for use in a variety of custom marketing executions.
Working knowledge of CRM and campaign management.
Experience with an enterprise level ESP and project management tools such as JIRA.
Working knowledge of Microsoft applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel & Outlook).
Ability to manage multiple deadline-oriented projects concurrently and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail and organizational skills.
Creative and conceptual thinker.
Strong quantitative and analytical skills.
Internally motivated, able to work proficiently in an independent and collaborative capacity.
Strong project management skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in retail, entertainment, sports and/or travel industry is preferred.
Proficiency in Dreamweaver/Photoshop skills.
Experience working with one or more major Email Service Providers. (Experian, Yesmail, ExactTarget / Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Zeta, etc.)
Experience using Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, and other marketing automation platforms.
Understanding of CAN-SPAM and email best practices.
Knowledge of ESP-specific scripting languages. (i.e., liquid scripting, AMPscript, etc.)

Compensation: $55k - $65k / year


Additional Information


EBG offers outstanding employee benefits including:

Medical, Dental & Vision
401k Match
Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability (Company Paid)
Company Paid Basic Life and AD&D
Additional Voluntary Benefits
Flexible Work Arrangements
3 Weeks of PTO + 5 Personal Days
Paid Holiday Break from Christmas to New Year
Paid Holidays
Fitness Reimbursement Program
Annual Day of Giving
Share in the FUN! EBG gives $1000 per year in Tickets-At-Work gift cards to full-time employees to experience and enjoy the savings marketplace!

The statements contained herein reflect general details as necessary to describe the principal functions of this job, the level of knowledge and skill typically required, and the scope of responsibility, but should not be considered an all-inclusive listing of work requirements. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Title: Database Developer (FT)
Description:
DATABASE DEVELOPER

Position Type: Full Time.
J ob Location: 1 PIERREPONT PLAZA SUITE 901 - BROOKLYN, NY.

About the Position.
Graham Windham seeks a Database Developer to assist in the development of our Enterprise Client Management System (ECMS). Will be responsible for developing management reports and ETL processes. The employee will report to the Chief Information Officer working closely with the Information Technology team and program leadership.

Duties and Responsibilities but not Limited:
To assist in the development of Graham Windham’s Enterprise Client Management System database (ECMS) as it pertains to Graham’s new Article 29I Health Home and Care Coordination services for youth in foster care.
Develop ETL processes to import client health and services data from external sources into ECMS.
Develop Management Reports assisting direct care staff and managers to ensure clients are receiving all required services and assessments.
Reports to the Chief Information Officer and works closely with other members of the IT team and program leadership.

Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree preferred.
Experience using Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio to model and develop integrated database solutions, including stored procedures and functions tied to existing databases.
Experience using Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services to extract data from other systems and integrate it into existing databases using standard data warehousing techniques.
Experience working with end-users to develop reports using Microsoft Report Builder.
Comfortable working remotely with remote supervision.
Prior non-profit experience is a plus.

Core Competencies:
Ability to work collaboratively and effectively on a team with peers and across programs.
Ability to successfully manage several projects simultaneously in a fast-paced work environment.
Ability to take directions and respond appropriately.
Ability to work well with people having different cultures, backgrounds, and identities.

Position Type: Full-Time.

Salary:
$80-$83K + Merit Pay + Benefits.
Commensurate with experience.

EOE.



About Graham Windham:



In full partnership with families & communities, Graham Windham strives to make a life-altering difference to children, youth and families affected by abuse, neglect and delinquency by providing each child we serve with a strong foundation for life: a safe, loving, permanent family and the opportunity and preparation to thrive in school and in the world. With over 400 full-time, part-time and On-call employees serving children and families in multiple programs throughout Westchester County, Manhattan, the Bronx, Brooklyn and Harlem, Graham Windham provides an exciting & enriching work experience.Graham has pioneered programs for New York City’s children, families and communities for over 200 years.Today, Graham is one of New York City’s leading social services organizations, providing educational and social services to over 4,000 children, young people, and parents in the Bronx, Brooklyn, and Harlem.GRAHAM ‘s IMPACT: 2019 HIGHLIGHT-Graham served 4,128 children, young people, and parents across New York City.-99% of families in our prevention program, who were at risk of having children placed in foster care, remained intact six months after receiving family support services.*95 kids in foster care reunited with their families within one year and 25 were adopted.*Over 90% of children in foster care who were reunified with their families avoided re-entering foster care in the year after reunification.*92% of young people in the Graham SLAM education and career support program graduated from high school by age 21 (compared with 22% of young people across the New York City foster care system).*We helped to lead close to 100 stakeholders in successfully advocating for New York City to invest $10 million in an approach similar to Graham SLAM for young people across NYC through the Fair Futures campaign.
